Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Antimicrobial Drapes in Primary Knee Arthroplasty

Trial_Design.evidence: An investigator-initiated, two-arm, non-blinded, multicenter, randomised controlled trial

Participants.evidence: Eligible participants were over 18 years, undergoing primary knee arthroplasty, excluding those with iodine allergy, prior knee surgery, septic arthritis, recent antibiotics, or inability to consent.

Intervention.evidence: 1659 patients assigned to either the intervention (antimicrobial drape) or control group.

Objective.evidence: This study investigates whether antimicrobial drapes reduce intraoperative microbial contamination in primary knee arthroplasty.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the proportion of contaminated patients, assessed intraoperatively.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 1659 patients assigned to either the intervention (antimicrobial drape) or control group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: 603 in the intervention and 584 in the control group were analysed.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Contamination was observed in 10% of the intervention group compared to 15% in the control group (odds ratio 0.61 [95% CI 0.43 to 0.87]; p = 0.005)
